citeinfo.title: Liquid water content of coastal California fog events, San Mateo County

descript.abstract: Liquid water content (LWC) measurements were collected during coastal fog events using specialized fog water collection units outfitted with six flat panel mesh collector frames. Simultaneous meteorological measurements were collected for four variables: wind, temperature, humidity, and solar radiation. The dataset includes ~12,000 records for two sites. Site one is in a grassland near the Midpeninsula Regional Open Space District (MROSD) Skyline Field Office (SFO) (WGS 84 Latitude 37.310723, Longitude -122.186204). The second site is in a Douglas fir forest clearing, 50 feet west of the MROSD North Purisima (NPUR) trailhead (Latitude 37.45018, Longitude -122.339407) parking lot. The fog collector consistes of six one-m2 frames. Each frame is outfitted with a different mesh configuration: coated or uncoated and one of three mesh types: 1) double-layer of 35% shade coefficient polyurethane Raschel mesh; 2) stainless steel 0.02 in, 49% shade coeffient wire mesh, or 3) FogHaTin, a 3-dimensional specialty textile polyurethane weave. The coating is a NBD-Nano hydrophobic formulation. Data were collected at SFO in 2016 and 2017 and at NPUR in 2017.
descript.purpose: Data were collected for two purposes, 1) explore the potential of fog water collection as a water resource for MROSD public lands in San Mateo County, California during the hot dry summer season (July to September) and 2) compare and assess the collection efficiency of three different mesh types coated or uncoated with NBD-Nano formula.

cntperp.cntorg: SOUTHWEST REGION: WESTERN GEOGRAPHIC SCI CTR

idinfo.datacred: USGS Climate and Landuse Mission Area, Midpeninsula Regional Open Space District, NBD-Nano

attracc.attraccr: cross checks were performed to assess accuracy but were not recorded within the files. Contact Alicia Torregrosa for more details.

dataqual.logic: Data were visually inspected for logical accuracy
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: No formal positional accuracy tests were conducted

vertacc.vertaccr: No formal positional accuracy tests were conducted

procstep.procdesc: Data were downloaded from data loggers, compiled into spreadsheets, checked for completeness, and converted to volumetrically relevant units (ml). In 2017 the sensors were connected to a Campbell CR1000 data logger and retrieved using the Campbell Scientific PC400 software. In 2016 the Spectrum tipping buckets were equipped with WatchDog data loggers and data retrieved with SpecWare Pro v9 software. Records with logical inconsistencies, such as anomalously high water volumes coinciding with field checks that applied water to collectors, or no data were deleted from the spreadsheets. Volumetric calculations were made using calibration coefficients derived with the calibration procedure (see appendix 1 in Sciencebase files at https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/file/get/5db78c84e4b0b0c58b5a49cc) conducted on each tipping bucket rain gauge (TBRG). Calibration coefficients are embedded in the metadata for each fog collector frame. The calibration procedure steps are: 1) set up TBRG with water spout connected to peristaltic pump and a data logger to count the number of tips per minute, 2) feed 500 ml of water into the TBRG through a tube connected to the pump set at a constant 6.0V voltage rate, 3) download tip data from data logger and average the tips/500 ml to derive the ml/tip rate for each TBRG.

cntperp.cntorg: SOUTHWEST REGION: WESTERN GEOGRAPHIC SCI CTR

spdoinfo.indspref: Site #1, Skyline field office (SFO) is located in the MROSD Skyline Ridge Preserve at the end of the Sunny Jim Trail Rd upslope of the Ipiwa Trail. Site # 2, NPUR, is located in the MROSD Purisima Preserve 150 ft west of the Purisima Creek North Ridge Trailhead parking lot.

enttyp.enttypd: Measurements of liquid water from fog and associated meteorological variables collected at SFO site during 2017

attr.attrdef: Record Number
attr.attrdefs: Producer defined

attrdomv.udom: Unique and sequential numerical record identifiers (start 180, end 7105 )

attr.attrdef: Timestamp
attr.attrdefs: Recorded by Campbell Scientific CR-1000 datalogger

attrdomv.udom: [Date hr:min] for each 1 minute interval with a tip of the tipping spoon in the tipping bucket rain gauge (TBRG). If all six TBRG record zero tips recording stops until one of the TBRG tips again.

attr.attrdef: Time interval since last recorded tip.
attr.attrdefs: Calculated from Timestamp attribute as recorded by Campbell Scientific CR-1000 datalogger

attr.attrdef: total ml/min from 1m2 uncoated raschel mesh calculated as (the number of tips recorded by gauge in one minute) multiplied by (the calibrated volume of 5.1 ml per tip for the tipping bucket rain gauge on Frame #1
attr.attrdefs: Measured by Texas Instruments TE525 tipping bucket rain gauge and recorded by Campbell Scientific CR-1000 datalogger

attr.attrdef: total ml/min from 1m2 raschel mesh coated with NBD-Nano hydrophobic formulation #1, calculated as (the number of tips recorded by gauge in one minute) multiplied by (the calibrated volume of 5.0 ml per tip for the tipping bucket rain gauge on Frame #2
